remove.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to take something away from, out of, or off the place where it is
remove.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Remove the old wallpaper and fill any holes in the walls.
Reference books may not be removed from the library.
remove.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer
remove.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: a cleaner that will remove wine stains
The college removed rules that prevented women from enrolling.
remove.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to force someone out of an important position or dismiss them from a job
remove.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Congress could remove the president from office.
remove.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to take off a piece of clothing
remove.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: He removed his hat and gloves.
remove.translation[0].definitions[3].not: In everyday English, people usually say that someone takes clothing off rather than removes it:
Is it OK if I take my coat off?
remove.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: remove
to make something no longer exist, especially something that was causing problems
Some stains are difficult to remove with ordinary washing powder.
All the obstacles to an agreement have now been removed.
get rid of somebody/something
to remove someone or something that you do not want. Get rid of  is much more common than remove in everyday English, but is usually only used in active sentences
They managed to get rid of all the weeds.
It was almost impossible to get rid of him.
eliminate
to completely get rid of something that you do not want, especially because it is unnecessary or causing problems
If you book online, this eliminates the need for a ticket.
The new system will help to eliminate costly delays.
eradicate
to completely get rid of a disease or a problem
The disease has been eradicated from most of Europe.
Street crime has almost been eradicated.
delete
to remove something that has been written on a computer, or stored in a computer
Do you want to delete this file?
Press 3 to delete the messages on your answerphone.
erase
to remove recorded sounds or pictures from a tape, or writing from paper
Shall I erase this video?
It’s better to cross out a mistake than to try to erase it.
to remove a part from a film, book, speech etc
The most violent scenes were cut.
Parts of his original speech were cut.
remove.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a distance or amount by which two things are separated
remove.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The X-ray operator works at a safe remove in a separate room.
remove.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: We need to consider the trade implications before border controls are removed.
an injunction removing the vote from 80,000 shareholders
The committee is recommending that the drug be removed from the market altogether.
remove.translation[2].definitions[1].def: to force someone to leave an important job or position
remove.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: The new directors intend to meet on Monday to remove the company’s chief executive.
The governor was removed from office following allegations of misconduct.
